I am working on the issue #19449, I have made some design changes to recent topic as mentioned by @Alya Abbott in issue description.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51414879/150413006-6a0a3841-6217-4cf3-ba0e-160e1ff88ef4.png)
Any suggestion on this design?
for now I don't have suggestions
In general I don't think that arrows work better that hashtag colors here. An I like the current design, since its easier to read topics image.png
so not having a separate visual column for topics is not better and having bigger colored rectangles isn't helpful more than just hashtag colors
But my concerns are agains the formulated issue, so I'm totally fine to live with that change until we discuss it again @Alya Abbott
@shlok patel(madrix01) please don't be discharged by my opinion. I joined design discussions recently.

Vlad Korobov said:

so not having a separate visual column for topics is not better and having bigger colored rectangles isn't helpful more than just hashtag colors

We are combining the stream and topic column as we are adding PMs to the recent topics.
if one doesn't have 2 items in a row but another one does we can still have visual columns for the case with Stream and Topic

I asked shlok patel(madrix01) to post here, because having seen the prototype, I don't think we'll be happy with the design as it's proposed in the issue. :)

Vlad Korobov said:

if one doesn't have 2 items in a row but another one does we can still have visual columns for the case with Stream and Topic

Is the idea to have a single "Conversations" header, but keep the current two-column alignment for streams/topics? If so, I think something like that could work, but I worry that it might not be clear enough what's going on with the topics. Perhaps we should also use the > separator?

@shlok patel(madrix01) Thanks for the screenshot! It confirms to me what I sort of suspected all along. I think, at least for the way my brain works, it's pretty important to keep streams and topics in their own columns. It seems like @Alya Abbott has predicted a little pushback here, so here's my pushback.

@Steve Howell (showell) my question above is roughly:

  1. Would it work to have a single combined heading (for consistency with PM threads), but otherwise use separate columns for stream/topic?
  2. If we think it might be confusing, is there anything we can do to help clarify what's going on?
I have no problem with a combined heading insofar as we have no intention to allow sorting columns.
To be clear, I understand this a tricky design problem. I honestly donâ€™t know the best way to integrate PMs into the view, but I hope we preserve most of the goodness for streams.

We can show PM's in different way such that they don't follow the table layout. They just stand different from the Stream messages, in that way there would be no conflict with the table heading, and it would highlight the PM's too and if filter for PMs are not applied it would appear as usual as it does now.
Should we show the last message of the PM?
We also probably still want to be able to click the topic column to sort; especially relevant since we're planning to add stre filtering to that widget.

shlok patel(madrix01) said:

We can show PM's in different way such that they don't follow the table layout. They just stand different from the Stream messages, in that way there would be no conflict with the table heading, and it would highlight the PM's too and if filter for PMs are not applied it would appear as usual as it does now.

@shlok patel(madrix01) perhaps you could show a mockup of what you have in mind here? I'm not sure I follow.

Tim Abbott said:

We also probably still want to be able to click the topic column to sort; especially relevant since we're planning to add stre filtering to that widget.

Hmm, is it important to be able to do this separately from the stream? Or is it OK to instead offer sorting by stream, and then by topic within stream? And to have a combined stream/topic filter as well?

I don't mean to say that combined approach is definitely fine or anything -- just wondering what folks think. I personally don't use the sorting functionality in Recent Topics.

@Alya Abbott
image.png
Like this the layout of the PM's is different from the stream messages and would differentiate from stream messages.
image.png
I have made this two mockups just to get the idea. I'm bad at designing :'(
@shlok patel (madrix01) I don't think "last message" will be possible for data reasons, so assume that won't be available in your design.
I would look at something like your first screenshot, but with the participants icons and list of names swapped, so all avatars are in the "participants" column.
@Tim Abbott Should we create a new recent_pm_row.hbs for the pm messages or should add conditionals in recent_topic_row.hbs?

Tim Abbott said:

shlok patel (madrix01) I don't think "last message" will be possible for data reasons, so assume that won't be available in your design.

I think shlok patel (madrix01) was just suggesting including the beginning of the text of the PM. Tim Abbott are you saying that would not be possible?

Alya Abbott said:

I think shlok patel (madrix01) was just suggesting including the beginning of the text of the PM. Tim Abbott are you saying that would not be possible?

Yes, that would be a problem as it would be in markdown format. Last message would not work I think.
you could have just the text "Private message" in place of the last message text under the topic column.
Should I change the font color for "Private Message" so that it would not conflict with the other topic name
Can you post some screenshots with color variations?

image.png
This would distinguish PM from other topics and made changes as @Tim Abbott suggested
sorry guys that I can not participate in this yet... Thinking about other things. But I'll later return with something solid
Should I create different template for private messages recent_pm_row.hbs?

There should be a people icon before the sender name, singe and multiple people icon used respectively for single and group private message. The Private Message text color sticks out to me, perhaps we can play with that.
Is there a way to get recent private message participants? for topics we have get_topic_recent_senders
No, we shouldn't need one here since we just list them in the order you display their names.
Also, you should add a private message filter here. I hope #19445 was in a good state. #19445 will take some review effort from Tim before it gets merged. I am trying to get it to review-able state.
Also, I opened Add stream filter to Recent topics. #20256 which is semi-relevant here.
Yes, the text color and size in the topics column should be the same as for stream messages. We can try italics or something if we need to distinguish the "Private message" text from topics.
@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) I have added filters to whether view PMs or not. I'll update the PR #20890 today.

image.png
I have updated the pr. But there is bug which is causing double PM in list (I don't know what's causing it). What are your views about the designs?
We want similar icon and text spacing as in stream # icon and name. Other than that, LGTM. For the row duplication issue, I can look at the pr when it's ready for review.

image.png
@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) I have added margin-right: 5px;inline the icons? is it correct ??

When I see "Othello/Prospero" in the stream column and "Private messages" in the topic column, it feels buggy to me, as if the hierarchy were upside down. I am gonna guess people would find swapping those two columns (for the PM rows) to just feel strange in a different way. I would at least consider not capitalizing the "P" in "Private messages."
I always thought that Private Messages is like a stream while people participating in PM are a topic.

Yeah, I agree, we should swap the new entries between stream and topic so that we have:

stream topic participants
private message <i> polonius <polonius-avatar>
@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) The issue of duplication is solved , the issue was due to constant key

As suggested above, I have swaped the stream and topic column. With user icon once in stream column and once in topic.
image.png
image.png
What are your views?
I instinctively like the second image more than the first but thinking about it, it's a tough choice.

@shlok patel (madrix01) Can I suggest one tweak? If we like the new version with the swapped columns, then I think we should spell the stream as "Private messages". I am honestly not a big fan of italicizing it. I do find the icon helpful, and I believe it belongs next to "Private messages".
(I probably wasn't super clear earlier about why I was suggesting lowercase "private messages". That was only in the context that we wouldn't swap the columns.)

I agree that icon should be on a Stream side, but I suggest to donâ€™t use multiple icons. Iâ€™m not fan of italics in general, but in this case I suggest to make the content of both columns be italic until we make some way to contrast the users inside private messages distinct â€¦
Can we show the user status there with a circle?
@Steve Howell (showell) for user status, we get get the class from buddy_data.get_user_circle_class(user_id);.Right ??
Yep, and you can look at pm_list.js, I believe, to see how we use it there.

image.png
After adding the user status
I think the intention is to put the dot next to Iago.

I would then put the envelope icon next to "Private messages". In my mind the Recent Topics view should be basically identical to the top-left corner view, except instead of two rows, two columns:

image.png

so...

(envelope) Private messages | (green circle) Tim Abbott
image.png.
That's my favorite version so far. (I would still eliminate the italics, especially when the envelope icon is present.)

image.png
Is the spaces between icon and text good?
I would try to make the envelope icon smaller and then line up everything in the Stream column. I'll let others post feedback on the Topic column--it feels fine to me, but others may disagree.

envelope icon is a bit weird, but there is no easy way to make icons and # be the same width. In the polished design version we will solve that problem. Meanwhile I think the last version is pretty good feature.

It would be interesting if we can show status-circle in front of every name in a group.

I would do circles a bit smaller too already.

Vlad Korobov said:

It would be interesting if we can show status-circle in front of every name in a group.

I think it would look a bit chaotic if we add status circle in front of each member of the group. (I'm not so good at design just a suggestion)

image.png
Decreased the size of both the icons, and adjusted the text to line up with stream name.
Nice iterations.
Nice -- I agree that this is much improved!

Can we make the spacing between the presence dot/group PM icon and the names be more consistent with the left sidebar? In particular:

  • The space between the group PM icon and the names looks too tight to me.
  • I can't quite tell if the presence dot in the left sidebar is centered or right-aligned compared to the group PM icon? But in any case, it's not left-aligned the way it is in the screenshot above, and I think it looks better.

Is there a limit on how many names we show if there are lots of participants on the thread? We should probably cut the list off with a "..." at some point; having it use up to 2 lines is probably fine.
@Alya Abbott No there no such limit for no. of participants yet, can we set according to the name of recipients and or the number of characters in the string?
@shlok patel (madrix01) rather than a fixed character limit, can you see if it's possible to abbreviate the names to whatever length is needed so that they don't take more than 2 lines of space?

I can't quite tell if the presence dot in the left sidebar is centered or right-aligned compared to the group PM icon? But in any case, it's not left-aligned the way it is in the screenshot above, and I think it looks better.

Should I change the icon alignment in recent topic setting or is it good? I was confused by this :sweat_smile:
Sorry for the confusion. Yes, please change the icon alignment in Recent topics to match the alignment in the left sidebar.

@Alya Abbott
image.png
Does this look correctly aligned?
Could you post a screenshot that includes a stream as well?
image.png
Thanks! I think the group PM icon should not stick out to the left of topic names the way it does in the screenshot above.

image.png
Fixed that
It seems like it might still be sticking out a little bit, but maybe that's an illusion? Anyway, looks pretty good to me.

Interesting; I might have wanted the presence / group-pm icon to stick out by its entire width, so that the names were aligned with the topics. Having them in their own space makes it easier to skim for them.
Mmm, I'd be open to trying that version as well if folks think it sounds promising.
looks pretty usable

image
added flex box to the stream column and moved the icons from topic column to the stream column. Had to use negative margin :(
I will find a way around.

image.png
Without the negative margin it looks like this.
I like the way it looks with the icons pulled out! But the negative margin (or something that accomplishes the equivalent) does look necessary to make the spacing look right.

Yeah, I think I agree that having the icons stick out on the left as in the first screenshot above looks good.

Can you confirm that it works OK in narrow windows, and nothing funky happens?

@Alya Abbott Responsive looks good i think, currently working clamping the line.
image.png

What if we keep the user-group icon aligning with the top of the list of users
i.e. - (keep user-group icon near left of 'Cordelia' in this screenshot.)
@Jai soni It might seem good for multiple lines, but I don't think it will look good for single line, that's why we are clamping after 2 lines.
hmm, agreed !

With line clamping it looks like this :
image.png
In this, can we align the user-group icon?
aligning would be a complex task as the icons and group names are in different column.
umm, would top:0 and position:absolute won't work?
nope :( , the icons disappear on position:absolule
That looks reasonable to me. Conceptually, the group PM icon is associated with all the users, not with Cordelia specifically.
Thanks for the quick iterations!
Cross-linking with the left sidebar discussion. We should probably be consistent about the vertical alignment of the group PM icon in these two locations.
yeah, which is why i suggested for the change here also

so know, what should we finally go with?
1.) keep PM grp icon at the top.
or
2.) keep it in middle of the length of pm_col

/poll How should we vertically align the group PM icon when participant names are on two lines? (in left sidebar and Recent topics)
Top
Middle
Cool, let's go with the middle option, then. :)
Let me know once we have the next prototype of this ready to deploy; I'm liking how it's looking.
Also, @Aman Agrawal (amanagr) you should probably do a code review for this -- we should start getting the data model pieces merged at least.
Most of it is ready, working on focus elements and node tests are remaining.

@shlok patel (madrix01) cool. I think it wouldn't be crazy to split the project up a bit to first have a PR that just adds whatever logic is needed in static/js/recent_topics_data.js to keep track of these (with perhaps just a few if statements to ignore the added data), so that we can review and merge that, and then have a smaller second PR that just does the UI pieces including details like focus elements.

Not sure if that sort of split actually makes sense -- I could imagine it adding a bunch of extra testing to make sure we don't break the existing UI in that first phase, not having seen the PR.

But this is the kind of project where different folks and types of testing/review will be involved in the focused attention on getting those two classes of details right, and it can help to split the work for that reason.

@Tim Abbott Yes we can do that, recent_topics_data.js basically allows messages with type "private" in topic map.
So first commit will consist of recent_topics_data.js allowing PMs, but this PMs will not be processed in recent_topics_ui.js.
Adding node tests for this feature would big task I think.

@Tim Abbott I have pushed the commit which adds type to topics map in recent_topics and generalize the function to get key from the private and stream message.
Commit ba4b97d PR #20890

Cool, Aman is the right reviewer for that piece. @shlok patel (madrix01) it'd be great if you can update that PR to link to where the UI code using it is -- it'll be easier to read if that's the case.

@Tim Abbott Currently the previous commit with all the UI code was removed during the rebase.
Commit with all the UI code. I should link this to PR, is this what you are asking?
Cool, that's good enough to let me skim for how this is put together while reviewing the data part.
As soon as current commit is good to go, i'll start working on adding template and connecting it with recent_topic_ui.js
@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) Tim Abbott I have pushed all the UI code to the PR #20890 in a different commit. can you give a please review on it?
A kind reminder for the PR. I have separated the commits as mentioned by Tim Abbott .
Yeah, I'll try to get this test deployed today if I can.
@Tim Abbott I have updated the PR #20890, can you please review it?
@shlok patel (madrix01) fyi #general>zulip 5.0 release plan

image.png
What are your views about this style?

Thanks for the mockup!

After seeing it, I prefer the previous version, with "Private messages" in the Stream column, and the names in the topic column. This version feels a bit messy visually and harder to parse to me. I think that outweighs the benefit of having more space for teh names.

Would be curious what other folks think.

I think what's tricky about this is that the typical case is much more having a bunch of 1:1 PM threads and maybe only 1-2 group PM threads; so while that looks messy, I'm not sure whether the core issue is just that 5 person group PMs look messy either way.

I also find the PMs with one or two people harder to parse at a glance in this layout, compared to using the Stream column to say "Private messages". So the previous version seems better to me in that (more common) use case as well.
Yeah, I think I agree with that.
Are we going to implement "Mark as read" with PM too in Recent topics? as the tooltip will be applied to all the Unreads.

I have added conditional for rendering unread of PM and topic messages. As most of the stuff for #22219 recent-topics: Mark as read using unread counters in Recent topics. isn't required for PMs.
And I matched the opacity of unread pm with opacity of unread topic message without hover i.e. opacity: 0.7;
image.png
Looks good to me!
but it arises a UI issue in keyboard navigation as there will be inconsistency with number of columns. Is there any possible way we can keep the number of columns to 4.
Sorry, can you clarify what the problem is? Is the challenge related to the mute button, or "mark as read", or something else altogether?

shlok (madrix01) said:

but it arises a UI issue in keyboard navigation as there will be inconsistency with number of columns. Is there any possible way we can keep the number of columns to 4.

I don't think that will be possible. We will just have write that piece of code for keyword navigation, as we discussed in the call.
Anyway, in case it's relevant, I think it's likely that we'll remove the "mute topic" button as part of the redesign, and we could do that sooner rather than later if that would simplify matters.

I have implemented the keyboard navigation as per new unread counters. #20890.
The keyboard navigation doesn't seem so consistent due to variable number of colums
Total columns for stream row with unread - 4
Total columns for stream row without unread - 3
Total columns for PM row with/without unread - 2
